org.integratedmodelling.thinklab.api.modelling
Interface IContext

All Superinterfaces:
IModelObject, INamespaceQualified
public interface IContext
extends IModelObject

A IContext is a named template to build an IObservationContext for an observation structure. The useful class that implements this is in the modelling plugin, which binds it to the "defcontext" clojure form and allows it to contain models that make it start with known states besides the extents.

Author:
ferdinando.villa

Method Summary
 IContext cloneExtents()
          Return a new context without states but with the same extents, transformations etc.
 IContext collapse(IConcept dimension)
          Return a new context with the given dimension collapsed to its total extent (1 state only), thereby eliminating the distribution in that dimension.

          Return the extent for a specific topology observable, or null if not there.

 boolean isCovered(int index)
          True if all the extent states correspondent to the passed index are defined in all dimensions (meaning there is a correspondend topology granule).

isCovered

boolean isCovered(int index)
True if all the extent states correspondent to the passed index are defined in all dimensions (meaning there is a correspondend topology granule). If this is false for any extent, states using this context will have a no-data value at that index.

Parameters:
index -
Returns:

getObservationContext

IContext getObservationContext(IObservation observation)
                               throws ThinklabException
Return a newly initialized IObservationContext to be used to contextualize the passed observation. This will build the common context and contextualization strategy for the obs, so it may be a long operation.

Parameters:
observation -

collapse

IContext collapse(IConcept dimension)
                  throws ThinklabException
Return a new context with the given dimension collapsed to its total extent (1 state only), thereby eliminating the distribution in that dimension. IState has an aggregate() function that will create the correspondent aggregated state.

Parameters:
dimension -
Returns:
Throws:
ThinklabException

map

IContextMapper map(IContext context)
                   throws ThinklabException
Return a context mapper that translates linear state coordinates to the equivalent ones for the passed context. The passed context must be isomorphic with this, i.e. it must have the same multiplicity or multiplicity 1 along any common dimension and have no multiple dimensions than this doesn't have.

Parameters:
context -
Returns:
Throws:
ThinklabException
